questions.guidance_text: Enter the full legal name of the company owning the construction equipment. This should match your registration documents. The insurance policy will be issued in this name and all claims will be payable to this entity.

Select your primary business activity. Different businesses have varying risk profiles - mining operations face higher risks than building construction. Your business type directly impacts premium rates and coverage terms.

Provide your complete registered office address for all policy-related correspondence. Include building name, street, area, city, state, and pincode. Policy documents and claim settlements will be sent to this address.
questions.placeholder: e.g., 456, Industrial Estate, Sector 37, Noida, Uttar Pradesh - 201301

questions.guidance_text: Enter your 15-character GST registration number for tax compliance. GST at 18% will be charged on the insurance premium. This should be your active GST number linked to the business address provided.
Enter your company's 10-character PAN. This is required for regulatory compliance and TDS purposes if applicable. The PAN should match with your GST registration details.

Enter the name of the person responsible for insurance matters and equipment management. This person will be contacted for policy servicing, renewals, and claims. Should be someone with decision-making authority.

Provide the 10-digit mobile number for immediate contact during emergencies or claims. This number will receive SMS alerts for policy updates and renewal reminders. Ensure it's always active and accessible.

Enter the official email address for receiving policy documents and correspondence. Use a regularly monitored company email, not personal email. Digital policy copies and endorsements will be sent here.

Select how your equipment operates. 'Floater' policies cover equipment moving between sites and are ideal for contractors. Fixed location policies are cheaper but restrict coverage to specified sites only. Most contractors need floater coverage.

For fixed locations, provide complete address. For floater policies, specify the geographic area of operations (e.g., 'Anywhere in Maharashtra' or 'Anywhere in India'). Wider coverage area means higher premium.
Enter the address where equipment is primarily stored when not in use. This could be your yard, warehouse, or main project site. Security arrangements at this location affect premium rates.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Company Yard, Plot 25, MIDC, Pune - 411018

questions.guidance_text: Enter the total count of all construction equipment and machinery you want to insure. Include all items from excavators to small generators. Each item should be listed separately in the equipment schedule.

Enter the total current market value of all equipment to be insured in INR. This should be the replacement value, not book value. Underinsuring leads to proportionate claim settlement. Include accessories and attachments value.

Upload Excel/PDF listing all equipment with: Make, Model, Year, Serial/Chassis Number, Current Value, and Engine/Registration Number. Accurate details are crucial for claims. Group similar items if you have large quantities.

Select all categories of equipment you own. Different categories have different risk profiles - cranes are higher risk than generators. This helps in accurate premium calculation and ensures appropriate coverage terms.

Enter the age of your oldest equipment in years. Equipment over 10 years may have restricted coverage or higher deductibles. Very old equipment (>15 years) might be covered for total loss only, not partial damages.
Enter the age of your newest equipment. New equipment (< 3 years) usually gets better coverage terms and lower deductibles. Mix of new and old equipment helps balance premium costs.

Indicate if equipment is purchased on loan/lease. Financed equipment requires the financier to be added as co-insured. The claim cheque may be jointly issued to you and the financier. This doesn't affect premium.

If equipment is financed, provide financier names and addresses. Multiple financiers can be added. They will be noted on the policy as loss payees. Include account/loan numbers for each financed equipment if available.
questions.placeholder: e.g., ABC Bank Ltd, Commercial Branch, Mumbai - Loan A/c: 1234567890

questions.guidance_text: Select all types of projects where your equipment operates. High-risk work like tunneling, mining, or marine works attract higher premiums. Equipment rental to others also increases risk due to varied usage patterns.

Select all conditions where equipment operates. Harsh conditions increase wear-and-tear and accident risks. Marine and underground operations are highest risk. Multiple challenging conditions compound the risk and premium.

Select average daily usage of equipment. Higher utilization means more wear-and-tear and accident exposure. 24-hour operations significantly increase risk. Premium rates increase with operating hours.

Indicate the training level of equipment operators. Certified operators reduce accident risks significantly. Many insurers offer premium discounts for fully trained operator teams. Mention if you have in-house training programs.

Select how equipment maintenance is handled. Regular professional maintenance reduces breakdown risks and can lower premiums. OEM service contracts are viewed most favorably. Ad-hoc maintenance increases risk.
Indicate if you maintain equipment service history. Good maintenance records help in claims settlement and can reduce premiums. Digital maintenance tracking systems are viewed positively by insurers.

Select all security measures at your equipment storage yard. Better security reduces theft risk and can lower premiums by 5-10%. GPS tracking is particularly important for high-value mobile equipment.

Select coverage scope. Comprehensive covers all risks including accidents, theft, and breakdowns. Total Loss Only is cheaper but covers only complete destruction. Most contractors need Comprehensive coverage for financed equipment.

Select insurance duration. Annual policies are standard. Multi-year policies may offer premium discounts but lock in terms. Project-specific periods align coverage with project duration. Short-term available for specific needs.
Select the date from which insurance coverage should begin. If renewing, this should be immediately after current policy expiry to avoid coverage gaps. Coverage starts at 00:01 hours on this date.

Select if you want coverage for damage/injury to third parties caused by your equipment. Highly recommended as equipment can cause severe third-party damages. Adds 5-10% to premium but provides crucial protection.
Select the maximum amount payable for third-party claims. Higher limits recommended for equipment operating in populated areas. Rs. 5-10 crores is standard for most contractors.

Select the amount you'll bear per claim before insurance pays. Higher deductibles reduce premium significantly (10-30% discount) but increase your out-of-pocket costs during claims. Balance premium savings with risk retention capacity. You can enter the amount in lakhs or crores (e.g., 50,00,000 or 5,00,00,000).

Check if you want coverage against terrorism-related damages. Recommended for equipment in sensitive areas or government projects. Adds minimal premium but provides peace of mind. Standard policies exclude terrorism.

Check to automatically increase sum insured by 10-15% during policy period to account for inflation. Prevents underinsurance as equipment values appreciate. Useful for imported equipment subject to currency fluctuations.

Check for coverage of internal mechanical/electrical failures not caused by external accidents. Important for sophisticated equipment like cranes and concrete pumps. Adds 15-20% premium but covers expensive breakdown repairs.

Select your claims frequency in past 3 years across all equipment insurance. Good claims history (no claims) can get you NCB discount of 10-20%. High claims frequency may result in higher premiums or coverage restrictions.

If you had claims, upload details including dates, equipment involved, cause of loss, claim amounts, and settlement status. Even for nil claims, a declaration helps. Transparency in claims history ensures smooth future settlements.
Enter name of current/last insurer if renewing or switching. Leave blank if buying insurance for first time. Previous insurer's claims history report helps in getting competitive quotes.
Disclose if any equipment is currently broken down or under repair. Such equipment may be excluded from coverage until repaired and certified fit. Non-disclosure can lead to claim rejection.
Provide details of equipment under repair including nature of damage, expected repair completion date, and repair cost. This equipment can be added to policy once repairs are complete and certified.
questions.placeholder: e.g., JCB Excavator Model 3DX, Engine repair, Expected completion 15/04/2025

questions.guidance_text: Provide any other relevant information about your equipment, operations, or specific insurance requirements. Include details about safety improvements, operator training programs, or unique risks. Full disclosure ensures appropriate coverage.
questions.placeholder: Enter any additional information relevant to the insurance

questions.guidance_text: By checking this box, you declare that all information provided is true and complete. You understand that any misrepresentation or suppression of material facts will void the insurance coverage and lead to claim rejection.
